org.apache.cassandra.db.composites

Interface CellNameType

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.Comparator<Composite>, CType
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractCellNameType, AbstractCompoundCellNameType, AbstractSimpleCellNameType, CompoundDenseCellNameType, CompoundSparseCellNameType, CompoundSparseCellNameType.WithCollection, SimpleDenseCellNameType, SimpleSparseCellNameType

    public interface CellNameType
extends CType
    The type of CellNames. In the same way that a CellName is a Composite, a CellNameType is a CType, but with a number of method specific to cell names. On top of the dichotomy simple/truly-composite of composites, cell names comes in 2 variants: "dense" and "sparse". The sparse ones are CellName where one of the component (the last or second-to-last for collections) is used to store the CQL3 column name. Dense are those for which it's not the case. In other words, we have 4 types of CellName/CellNameType which correspond to the 4 type of table layout that we need to distinguish: 1. Simple (non-truly-composite) dense: this is the dynamic thrift CFs whose comparator is not composite. 2. Composite dense: this is the dynamic thrift CFs with a CompositeType comparator. 3. Simple (non-truly-composite) sparse: this is the thrift static CFs (that don't have a composite comparator). 4. Composite sparse: this is the CQL3 layout (note that this is the only one that support collections).

    • Method Detail

      • isDense

        boolean isDense()
        Whether or not the cell names for this type are dense.

      • clusteringPrefixSize

        int clusteringPrefixSize()
        The number of clustering columns for the table this is the type of.

      • prefixBuilder

        CBuilder prefixBuilder()
        A builder for the clustering prefix.

      • staticPrefix

        Composite staticPrefix()
        The prefix to use for static columns. Note that create() methods below for creating CellName automatically handle static columns already for convenience, and so there is not need to pass this prefix for them. There is few other cases where we need the prefix directly however.

      • hasCollections

        boolean hasCollections()
        Whether or not there is some collections defined in this type.

      • supportCollections

        boolean supportCollections()
        Whether or not this type layout support collections.

      • collectionType

        ColumnToCollectionType collectionType()
        The type of the collections (or null if the type has not collections).

      • addOrUpdateCollection

        CellNameType addOrUpdateCollection(ColumnIdentifier columnName,
                                 CollectionType newCollection)
        Return the new type obtained by adding/updating to the new collection type for the provided column name to this type.

      • setSubtype

        CellNameType setSubtype(int position,
                      AbstractType<?> newType)
        Returns a new CellNameType that is equivalent to this one but with one of the subtype replaced by the provided new type.
        Specified by:
        setSubtype in interface CType

      • rowMarker

        CellName rowMarker(Composite prefix)
        Creates a row marker for the CQL3 having the provided clustering prefix. Note that this is only valid for CQL3 tables (isCompound() and !isDense()) and should only be called for them.

      • create

        CellName create(Composite prefix,
              ColumnDefinition column)
        Creates a new CellName given a clustering prefix and a CQL3 column. Note that for dense types, the column can be null as a shortcut for designing the only COMPACT_VALUE column of the table.

      • create

        CellName create(Composite prefix,
              ColumnDefinition column,
              java.nio.ByteBuffer collectionElement)
        Creates a new collection CellName given a clustering prefix, a CQL3 column and the collection element.

      • makeCellName

        CellName makeCellName(java.lang.Object... components)
        Convenience method to create cell names given its components. This is equivalent to CType#make() but return a full cell name (and thus require all the components of the name).

      • cellFromByteBuffer

        CellName cellFromByteBuffer(java.nio.ByteBuffer bb)
        Deserialize a Composite from a ByteBuffer. This is equilvalent to CType#fromByteBuffer but assumes the buffer is a full cell name. This is meant for thrift/cql2 to convert the fully serialized buffer we get from the clients.

      • CQL3RowBuilder

        CQL3Row.Builder CQL3RowBuilder(CFMetaData metadata,
                             long now)
        Creates a new CQL3Row builder for this type. See CQL3Row for details.

        void addCQL3Column(ColumnIdentifier id)

      • removeCQL3Column

        void removeCQL3Column(ColumnIdentifier id)

      • newDeserializer

        CellNameType.Deserializer newDeserializer(java.io.DataInput in)
        Creates a new Deserializer. This is used by AtomDeserializer to do incremental and on-demand deserialization of the on disk atoms. See AtomDeserializer for details.
